projects.title: 100 East 53rd Street
projects.tools: Meteor JS Framework, SASS, Docker, TravisCI, AWS EC2
projects.description: While at DBOX, I developed the front-end for the 100 East 53rd Street website. This website was showcased on Site Inspire in the typographic style category as well as on Uplabs for its Gallery interface.

projects.title: 108 Leonard
projects.description: I developed this website at DBXD. The website's main focus is typography and simple animation. The form has client-side validation and uses Google i18n Libphonenumber to populate and convert country to phone number country code.

projects.title: 432 Park Avenue
projects.tools: Assemble.io, Grunt, SCSS, JavaScript, Node.JS, TravisCI, AWS EC2
projects.description: This is a new, complete redesign of the 432 Park Avenue website I did while at DBXD. It has a split-screen desktop design where the text and images move independently of each other via mouse scroll. The website uses JavaScript DOM manipulation to switch to a completely different, top-down scrolling mobile design.

images.alt: 432 Park Avenue full width image slid out
432 Park Avenue mobile full width image
432 Park Avenue mobile full width image sliding overlay

projects.title: The Century Plaza
projects.tools: PUG, SCSS, JavaScript, Neat, Node.JS, TravisCI, AWS EC2
projects.description: This is a "teaser" site for The Century Plaza I have developed at DBXD.  It doesn't use any task runners such as Gulp or Grunt, but rather relies on npm scripts to minify and compile. The website's second page contains a PDF deconstructed into an online flipbook.

projects.title: Bay Park Centre
projects.tools: Jekyll, SCSS, Grunt, Ruby, Node.JS, TravisCI, AWS EC2
projects.description: A website I developed at DBXD, it uses a modular approach to Jekyll with JSON data for scalable content creation and Pano2VR for panoramic views. It also utilizes many play-on-scroll inline videos and hooks into Google Spreadsheets for press content.

projects.title: The Residences at the West Hollywood Edition
projects.tools: PUG, SCSS, Neat, Velocity, Google Maps API, Gulp, Node.JS, TravisCI, AWS S3 with CloudFront
projects.description: A website I developed at DBOX and DBXD. It is a full, multipage site, featuring hijacked scrolling on desktop and a seamless scrolling experience on mobile. The availability page features JavaScript writing to the DOM, and sorting residences. The home page has videos that appear on hover over links. And the Location page features an interactive Google Maps API-powered neighborhood map.
